verses.text: 施捨不可張揚「你們小心，不要在眾人面前行你們的義，讓他們看見；如果這樣，就得不到你們天父的賞賜。

words.note: Lit. 'bestow and give up'.

words.definition: may, can (used with 不 for prohibition)

words.note: Lit. 'Heaven Father'.

verses.text: 因此你施捨的時候，不可到處張揚，好像偽君子在會堂和街上所作的一樣，以博取眾人的稱讚。我實在告訴你們，他們已經得了他們的賞賜。

words.definition: may, can (used with 不 for prohibition)

words.note: Lit. 'false gentleman'.

words.definition: in order to, so as to

verses.text: 你施捨的時候，不要讓左手知道右手所作的，
好使你的施捨是在隱密中行的。你父在隱密中察看，必定報答你。
如何禱告（路11:2~4）「你們祈禱的時候，不可像偽君子；他們喜歡在會堂和路口站著祈禱，好讓人看見。我實在告訴你們，他們已經得了他們的賞賜。

words.note: A verb-object compound, lit. 'pray message'.
Refers to the Gospel of Luke.
Similar to 禱告, emphasizing request.

words.definition: may, can (used with 不 for prohibition)

verses.text: 但你祈禱的時候，要進到密室裡去，關上門，向在隱密中的父祈禱。你父在隱密中察看，必定報答你。

words.note: Refers to God the Father.
Refers to God the Father.

verses.text: 你們祈禱的時候，不可重複無意義的話，像教外人一樣，他們以為話多了就蒙垂聽。

words.note: Used with 不 to express prohibition.
Often implies receiving from a superior.

verses.text: 你們不可像他們，因為在你們祈求以先，你們的父已經知道你們的需要了。

words.note: Used with 不 to express prohibition.
Refers to God the Father.

verses.text: 所以你們要這樣祈禱：『我們在天上的父，願你的名被尊為聖，

words.note: Refers to God the Father.

verses.text: 願你的國降臨，願你的旨意成就在地上，如同在天上一樣。
我們每天所需的食物，求你今天賜給我們；

words.note: Commonly used in religious contexts for divine giving.

verses.text: 赦免我們的罪債，好像我們饒恕了得罪我們的人；

words.note: Often used in religious or legal contexts.
Lit. 'sin debt,' referring to spiritual trespasses.
Emphasizes showing mercy and leniency.
Lit. 'incur guilt/offense (upon someone).'

verses.text: 不要讓我們陷入試探，救我們脫離那惡者。』（有些後期抄本在此有「因為國度、權柄、榮耀，全是你的，直到永遠。阿們」一句）

words.note: Lit. 'test and probe,' referring to spiritual trials.
Used for escaping from negative situations or influences.
Refers to the devil or evil spiritual forces.
Refers to a handle of power, thus authority.
Often refers to divine splendor or honor.
Hebrew transliteration, meaning 'so be it' or 'truly'.

verses.text: 如果你們饒恕別人的過犯，你們的天父也必饒恕你們。

words.note: Emphasizes showing mercy and leniency.
Lit. 'passing a limit and offending.'
A common title for God in Christianity.
Emphasizes showing mercy and leniency.

verses.text: 如果你們不饒恕別人，你們的父也必不饒恕你們的過犯。

words.note: Emphasizes showing mercy and leniency.
Used in this context to refer to God as Father.
Emphasizes showing mercy and leniency.
Lit. 'passing a limit and offending.'

verses.text: 禁食不讓人知「你們禁食的時候，不可像偽君子那樣愁眉苦臉，他們裝成難看的樣子，叫人看出他們在禁食。我實在告訴你們，他們已經得了他們的賞賜。

words.note: Lit. 'forbid eating'
Indicates a modifying clause.
Lit. 'false gentleman'
An idiom describing a sad, troubled face.
Lit. 'difficult to look at'.
Lit. 'see out'.
Indicates completed action.

verses.text: 可是你禁食的時候，要梳頭洗臉，

words.note: A verb-object compound.
A verb-object compound.

verses.text: 不要叫人看出你在禁食，只讓在隱密中的父看見。你父在隱密中察看，必定報答你。

words.note: Refers to God the Father in this context.
Refers to God the Father in this context.

verses.text: 積財於天（路12:32~34）「不可為自己在地上積聚財寶，因為地上有蟲蛀，有鏽侵蝕，也有賊挖洞來偷。

words.note: A verb-object compound.
Classical Chinese preposition, often replaced by 在 (zài).
Bible verse reference.
Describes damage caused by insects.
A verb-object compound.

verses.text: 要為自己積聚財寶在天上，那裡沒有蟲蛀鏽蝕，也沒有賊挖洞來偷。

words.note: Combined term for insect and rust damage.

verses.text: 你的財寶在哪裡，你的心也在哪裡。
裡面的光（路11:34~36）「眼睛就是身體的燈。如果你的眼睛健全，全身就都明亮；
如果你的眼睛有毛病，全身就都黑暗。如果你裡面的光變成黑暗，這是多麼的黑暗！
不要為明天憂慮（路12:22~31）「一個人不能服事兩個主人；他若不是恨這個愛那個，就是忠於這個輕視那個。你們不能服事　神，又服事金錢（「金錢」亞蘭文是「瑪門」）。

words.note: Common in biblical texts for serving God or master.
More formal than 如果 (rúguǒ).
Common in biblical texts for serving God or master.
Refers to the singular God, often capitalized in English.
Common in biblical texts for serving God or master.
In this context, often refers to Mammon, personified wealth.
亞 is a common prefix for transliterations of foreign names/places.
Personified wealth or avarice in biblical texts.

verses.text: 所以我告訴你們，不要為生命憂慮吃甚麼喝甚麼，也不要為身體憂慮穿甚麼。難道生命不比食物重要嗎？身體不比衣服重要嗎？

words.note: Used to pose a rhetorical question, suggesting a negative answer.

verses.text: 你們看天空的飛鳥：牠們不撒種，不收割，也不收進倉裡，你們的天父尚且養活牠們；難道你們不比牠們更寶貴嗎？

words.note: Specifically for animals, as opposed to '他們' for people.
A respectful title for God.
Implies 'if even this is true, then something more important must be true'.
Used to ask rhetorical questions, expecting a negative answer.

verses.text: 你們中間誰能用憂慮使自己的壽命延長一刻呢？

words.note: Refers to a short period of time.

verses.text: 何必為衣服憂慮呢？試想田野的百合花怎樣生長，它們不勞苦，也不紡織。

words.definition: why must?, there is no need

words.note: Often interpreted as a general term for beautiful wildflowers.

verses.text: 但我告訴你們，就是所羅門最威榮的時候所穿的，也比不上這花中的一朵。

words.note: Indicates the object of a verb or a passive construction.

verses.text: 田野的草，今天還在，明天就投進爐裡，　神尚且這樣妝扮它們；小信的人哪，何況你們呢？

words.note: The space before '神' is a traditional reverent spacing in Chinese.
Implies 'if even this is true, then something more important must be true'.
A common biblical term to describe those with weak faith.
Used to express exclamation, urgency, or rhetorical question.
Used in rhetorical questions to emphasize a point.

verses.text: 所以不要憂慮，說：『我們該吃甚麼？喝甚麼？穿甚麼？』
這些都是教外人所尋求的，你們的天父原知道你們需要這一切。

words.note: Lit. 'people outside the teaching'; refers to non-Jews/non-Christians.
Used in the structure '所 V 的' to form a nominal phrase.
Often used in a spiritual sense in biblical contexts.
A title for God in Christianity.

verses.text: 你們要先求他的國和他的義，這一切都必加給你們。

words.note: Functions as an auxiliary verb expressing obligation or command.
Often means 'to seek after' or 'to ask for' spiritually.
Refers specifically to God's kingdom or the kingdom of heaven.
Often refers to God's righteousness or justification.

verses.text: 所以不要為明天憂慮，因為明天自有明天的憂慮，一天的難處一天當就夠了。」

words.note: In this context, means to 'bear' or 'cope with' difficulties.
